## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
library(sf)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggthemes)
library(ggspatial)
library(units)
library(nngeo)
```

```{r}
township<-st_read ("LFTEA.geojson")
```
```{r}
parks<-st_read ("Parks.geojson")
```

```{r}
Bustop<-st_read ("Busstop.geojson")
```

```{r}
offices<-st_read("offices.geojson")
```
```{r}
CT_state_plane <- "+proj=tmerc +lat_0=0 +lon_0=19 +k=1 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +ellps=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs"

Bustop <- Bustop %>%
  st_transform(CT_state_plane)

offices <- offices %>%
  st_transform(CT_state_plane)

parks <- parks %>% 
  st_transform(CT_state_plane)

township <- township %>%
  st_transform(CT_state_plane)
```

```{r}
ggplot(township) +
  geom_sf(fill = "lightblue", color = NA) +
  geom_sf(data = parks, color = "lightgreen", size = 0.01) +
  geom_sf(data = Bustop, size = 0.01) +
  geom_sf(data= offices, fill = NA, color = "gray") +
  theme_map() +
  annotation_scale()
```
